title: Path Basics
content:
What is a path?

A path describes a location in the filesystem tree.

Special segments

  • . current directory
  • .. parent directory
pwd
ls .
ls ..

Separators and spaces

Paths use / as separator. If a filename has spaces, quote it.

mkdir -p "My Folder"
touch "My Folder/file.txt"
ls "My Folder"
